answers.answer:
Individuals can enter Romania by obtaining temporary protection, with a short-stay right, or as an asylum seeker. It is also possible to apply for asylum within Romania at a later point, or at the border if no documents are presented.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read under the sections "Temporary protection", "Short stay", and "Applying for asylum".
answers.bResponse:
Individuals can enter Romania by obtaining temporary protection, with a short-stay right, or as an asylum seeker. It is also possible to apply for asylum within Romania at a later point, or at the border if no documents are presented.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read under the sections "Temporary protection", "Short stay", and "Applying for asylum". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status

answers.answer:
An individual's rights in Romania are determined by their status, such as temporary protection, short-stay, or asylum seeker. Each status grants specific rights, including automatic permit validity until a certain date, a limited stay period, or protection from deportation.

To find detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status` and read under the sections 'Temporary protection', 'Short stay', 'Asylum seeker', and 'My rights'.
answers.bResponse:

Temporary protection in Romania is a special form of protection intended for people fleeing the war in Ukraine.

To find more detailed information, visit the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status` and look under the "Temporary protection" sections.

answers.answer:
A temporary protection permit in Romania is automatically valid until March 4, 2026, and beneficiaries do not need to apply for an extension.

To find this information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status` and read under the "Temporary protection" section.

answers.answer:
Ukrainian nationals are required to present a valid passport at the border crossing to enter Romania for a short stay, allowing them to remain for up to 90 days.

To find more detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and look under the 'Short stay' section.

In Romania, you are considered an asylum seeker from the moment you ask for asylum, either in writing or verbally.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and read under the section "Applying for asylum".

No, an asylum seeker cannot be deported to their country of origin from Romania.

You can find this detailed information on the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status under the section "Applying for asylum".

answers.answer:
If you cannot present any documents upon entering Romania, you will need to apply for asylum at the border.

To find more detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/legal-status and look for the paragraph that begins with "If you cannot present any documents upon entering Romania..." which is located near the end of the 'My rights' section.

For specific details like hotline numbers and website links, refer to the "For support in other European countries" section on the webpage.
